comments:
From the Callisto mailing list:
C:\Dev\test\packer>pack200 -r ExportToXML.jar 
Exception in thread "main" java.io.IOException: Bad constant pool tag 13 
        at com.sun.java.util.jar.pack.ClassReader.readConstantPool(ClassReader.java:232) 
        at com.sun.java.util.jar.pack.ClassReader.read(ClassReader.java:123) 
        at com.sun.java.util.jar.pack.PackerImpl$DoPack.readClass(PackerImpl.java:490) 
        at com.sun.java.util.jar.pack.PackerImpl$DoPack.run(PackerImpl.java:464) 
        at com.sun.java.util.jar.pack.PackerImpl.pack(PackerImpl.java:73) 
        at com.sun.java.util.jar.pack.Driver.main(Driver.java:261)

This .class file is corrupted.
I recompile it and it works fine. It might have been committed as an ascii file.

I think the right way to do it is to add a:
.cvsignore file in this sample project.
The file would contain only this line:
bin

Get rid of the contents of the output folder in the CVS repository. Then it would not be a problem to use pack200 on this project.

In general, it is a bad idea to commit output folders. The class file would be created once the project is checked out from CVS and build on the user machine.

Moving to Valentina to reflect that this bugzilla is for a Platform.UI example.

The original file, http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/monitoring/org.eclipse.hyades.trace.sample/archive/ExportViewerGeneratorSample/bin/org/eclipse/tptp/exportviewergenerator/sample/Attic/ExportViewerGeneratorSamplePlugin.class?rev=1.1&hideattic=0&cvsroot=TPTP_Project&content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup
was added to org.eclipse.hyades.trace.sample by Valentina on Wed Aug 31, 2005. I don't know why a .class file was checked into CVS and thus I'm reluctant to remove it. Valentina, I know that you're on a business trip; please let me know if you want the .class file removed from CVS or not. 

Olivier said, "This would need to be fixed for next RC candidate of Callisto if pack200 needs to be used for this project"
Moving to Eugene for further investigation
This should have an easy solution

The .class files have been removed from http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/monitoring/org.eclipse.hyades.trace.sample/archive/ExportViewerGeneratorSample/bin/org/eclipse/tptp/exportviewergenerator/sample/Attic since 4.2.  Marking bug as WORKSFORME.  Please reopen bug if you experience this problem again.
Updated target to match the iteration when this defect was processed
